snippet: The mainstream media are frequently faulted as biased against conservative causes. But it seems a dubious notion when the ownership of the megaphone is increasingly up for grabs.
abstract: David Carr The Media Equation column rejects notion that the mainstream media are biased against conservative causes, citing some big players who do not peddle liberal theology; says many Republicans see bias against Mitt Romney lurking in every live shot, but the growing hegemony of conservative voices makes manufacturing a partisan conspiracy a practical impossibility.
lead_paragraph: The mainstream media are frequently faulted as biased against conservative causes. But it seems a dubious notion when the ownership of the megaphone is increasingly up for grabs.

headline.seo: Challenging the Claims of Media Bias - the Media Equation
headline.main: Tired Cries of Bias Don’t Help Romney
headline.print_headline: Tired Cries Of Bias Don’t Help Romney
